intro: Polyadenia subumbelliflora, commonly known as the clustered bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many economically important crops and weeds. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, white to pale purple flowers arranged in clusters. It produces rounded, inflated pods that contain several seeds, a feature typical of the mustard family. Polyadenia subumbelliflora is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides, thriving in full sun to partial shade.
